AccessToResourceDenied.docs: This error occurs when you try to access Belvo's resource without the correct permissions.

message.docs:
A short description of the error. 

For `access_to_resource_denied` errors, the description is:
  
  - `You don't have access to this resource.`.

request_id.docs: A 32-character unique ID of the request (matching a regex pattern of: `[a-f0-9]{32}`). Provide this ID when contacting the Belvo support team to accelerate investigations.

Account.docs:
Details regarding the account.

**Note**: For our recurring expenses resource, this account relates to the account that was analyzed to generate the recurring expenses report.

balance_type.docs: Indicates whether this account is either an `ASSET` or a `LIABILITY`. You can consider the balance of an `ASSET` as being positive, while the balance of a `LIABILITY` as negative.

bank_product_id.docs:
*This field has been deprecated.*

*The institution's product ID for the account type.*

collected_at.docs: The ISO-8601 timestamp when the data point was collected.

created_at.docs: The ISO-8601 timestamp of when the data point was last updated in Belvo's database.

currency.docs:
The currency of the account. For example:
-  BRL (Brazilian Real)
-  COP (Colombian Peso)
-  MXN (Mexican Peso)

 Please note that other currencies other than in the list above may be returned.

funds_data.docs: One or more funds that contribute to the the pension account.

id.docs: The unique identifier created by Belvo used to reference the current account.

internal_identification.docs:
*This field has been deprecated.*

*The institution's internal identification for the account.*

last_accessed_at.docs: The ISO-8601 timestamp of Belvo's most recent successful access to the institution for the given link.

link.docs: The `link.id` the account belongs to.

name.docs: The account name, as given by the institution.

number.docs: The account number, as designated by the institution.

public_identification_name.docs: The public name for the type of identification. For example: `

`.

 For  Brazilian savings and checking accounts, this field will be `AGENCY/ACCOUNT`.

public_identification_value.docs:
The value for the `public_identification_name`.

 For  Brazilian savings and checking accounts, this field will be the agency and bank account number, separated by a slash.
For example: `0444/45722-0`.

type.docs: The account type, as designated by the institution.

AccountsBalance.docs: Details regarding the current and available balances for the account.

available.docs:
The balance that the account owner can use.
- ** Checking and saving accounts**:

The available balance may be different to the `current` balance due to pending transactions.
- ** Credit cards**:

The credit amount the user still has available for the current period. The `available` balance may be different to the `current` balance due to pending transactions or future instalments.
- ** Loan accounts**:

The present value required to pay off the loan, as provided by the institution.

**Note:** If the institution does not provide this value, we return `null`.

current.docs:
The current balance is calculated differently according to the type of account.

- ** Checking and saving accounts**:

The user's account balance at the `collected_at` timestamp.
- ** Credit cards**:

The amount the user has spent in the current card billing period (see `credit_data.cutting_date` for information on when the current billing period finishes).
- ** Loan accounts**:

The amount remaining to pay on the users's loan (same as `loan_data.outstanding_balance`).

total_exemptions_and_deductions.docs: Sum total of all exempt and deductions that can be applied to the taxpayer's income.

total_ordinary_net_income.docs: Sum total of the taxpayer's income (gross income - exemptions - deductions).

metadata.docs:
Optional and customizable object where you can provide any additional key-value pairs for your internal purposes. For example, an internal reference number for the payment intent.

 **Note**: You can only provide up to 50 keys (keys can have up to 50 characters each and each value can be up to 500 characters). We do not support nested objects, only ASCII values.

number.docs: The bank account number of the payment beneficiary.

providers.docs: Information about the payment service provider, required in order to establish a connection and process requests. For PSE, the value must be `payments_way`.

identifier.docs: The document number of the customer's ID.

identifier.docs: The document number of the customer's ID.

name.docs: The full name of the customer you want to create.

allowed_payment_method_types.docs: A list of payment method types allowed in this payment intent. For OFPI, this value must be set to `open_finance`.

amount.docs:
Amount to be paid by your customer. For OFPI, you can send through numbers with up to two decimal points, separated by a `.` period. For example: `1234.12`

**Note:** You can send through this value either as a string or an float. Regardless of the type you choose to send the `amount` as, Belvo returns a string with two decimal points, separated by a period ( `.`). For example, `1234.12`.

customer.docs: Belvo's unique ID to reference the customer.

expires_in.docs:
The payment link expiration time. It allows the following formats to be sent through:

  - whole number + `m` for x amount of minutes. For example: `15m` for 15 minutes.
  - whole number + `h` for x amount of hours. For example: `12h` for 12 hours.
  - whole number + `d` for x amount of days. For example: `30d` for 30 days.

   The minimum expiration time allowed for a payment link is `1m` (1 minute) and the maximum is `90d` (90 days).

CreatePaymentLinkOfpiAmount.docs:
Amount to be paid by your customer. For OFPI, you can send through numbers with up to two decimal points, separated by a `.` period. For example: `1234.12`

**Note:** You can send through this value either as a string or an float. Regardless of the type you choose to send the `amount` as, Belvo returns a string with two decimal points, separated by a period ( `.`). For example, `1234.12`.

allowed_payment_method_types.docs: A list of payment method types allowed in this payment intent. For PSE, this value must be set to `pse`.

amount.docs:
Amount to be paid by your customer. For PSE, you can only send whole numbers. For example: `350000`.

**Note:** You can send this value either as a string or an integer. Regardless of the type you choose to send the `amount` as, Belvo returns a string with two decimal points, separated by a period ( `.`). For example, `350000.00`.

customer.docs: Belvo's unique ID to reference the customer.

expires_in.docs:
The payment link expiration time. It allows the following formats to be sent through:

  - whole number + `m` for x amount of minutes. For example: `15m` for 15 minutes.
  - whole number + `h` for x amount of hours. For example: `12h` for 12 hours.
  - whole number + `d` for x amount of days. For example: `30d` for 30 days.

   The minimum expiration time allowed for a payment link is `1m` (1 minute) and the maximum is `90d` (90 days).

CreatePaymentLinkPseAmount.docs:
Amount to be paid by your customer. For PSE, you can only send whole numbers. For example: `350000`.

**Note:** You can send this value either as a string or an integer. Regardless of the type you choose to send the `amount` as, Belvo returns a string with two decimal points, separated by a period ( `.`). For example, `350000.00`.

The type of account.
We return one of the following enum values:
  - `CHECKING_ACCOUNT`
  - `CREDIT_CARD`
  - `INVESTMENT_ACCOUNT`
  - `LOAN_ACCOUNT`
  - `PENSION_FUND_ACCOUNT`
  - `RECEIVABLES_ACCOUNT`
  - `SAVINGS_ACCOUNT`
  - `UNCATEGORIZED`
  - `null`

EnumCategorizationTransactionType.docs:
The direction of the transaction.
Can be either:

  - `INFLOW` indicates a received transaction.
  - `OUTFLOW` indicates a sent transaction.

EnumCustomerIdentifierTypeOfpi.docs:
The customer's ID document type.

-  Brazil options: `CPF` or `CNPJ`.

EnumCustomerIdentifierTypePse.docs:
The customer's ID document type.

-  Colombia options: `CC`, `PP`, `CE`, `TI`, or `NIT`.

EnumCustomerType.docs:
The type of customer. Can be either:

  - `INDIVIDUAL`
  - `BUSINESS`
    

**Notes:** For  Colombia's PSE, you can only create customers of type `INDIVIDUAL`.

EnumEmploymentRecordDocumentType.docs:
The type of document related to the individual. We return one of the following values:

  - `NSS`
  - `CURP`

EnumEmploymentRecordStatus.docs: Indicates whether or not the individual is currently `EMPLOYED` or `UNEMPLOYED`.

EnumEmploymentRecordStatusUpdateEvents.docs:
The event that caused the change in employment status or salary. We return one of the following values:
  
  - `DISMISSED_RESIGNED`
  - `SALARY_MODIFICATION`
  - `HIRED`
  - `VOLUNTARY_CONTRIBUTION`
  - `ABSENCE`
  - `SICK_LEAVE`

EnumIncomeMinimumConfidenceLevelRequest.docs:
The minimum confidence level of the incomes you want to get information for.

You can send through one of the following values:

  - `HIGH`
  - `MEDIUM`
  - `LOW`

EnumIncomeSourceType.docs:
The type of source we generate income insights from.
We return one of the following enum values:

  - `BANK`

EnumIncomeStreamConfidence.docs:
Belvo's level of confidence for future incomes.

We return one of the following enum values:

  - `HIGH`
  - `MEDIUM`
  - `LOW`

EnumIncomeStreamFrequency.docs:
How often the income is received.

We return one of the following enum values:

  - `MONTHLY` - For transactions that occur once per month.
  - `FORTNIGHTLY` - For transactions that occur once every two weeks.
  - `WEEKLY` - For transactions that occur once per week.
  - `IRREGULAR` - For transactions that do not occur on a defined frequency pattern.
  - `SINGLE` - For transactions that occur only once and do not repeat.

EnumIncomeStreamType.docs:
The type of income used in the calculations.

We return one of the following enum values:

  - `SALARY`
  - `GOVERNMENT`
  - `INTEREST`
  - `RENT`
  - `RETIREMENT`
  - `FREELANCE`
  - `ALTERNATIVE_INCOME`
  - `TRANSFER`
  - `DEPOSIT`
  - `UNKNOWN`

EnumIncomeVerificationAccountCategory.docs:
The type of account.
Can be either:
  - `CHECKING_ACCOUNT`
  - `SAVINGS_ACCOUNT`

EnumIncomeVerificationAccountHolderType.docs:
The type of account holder. Can be:

  - `INDIVIDUAL`

EnumIncomeVerificationType.docs:
The direction of the transaction:
  
- `INFLOW` indicates money coming into the account.

EnumInstitutionIntegrationType.docs:
The type of technology used to access the institution. We return one of the following values:

- `credentials`: Uses Belvo's scraping technology, combined with user credentials, to perform requests.
- `openbanking`: Uses the bank's openbanking API to perform requests.

EnumInstitutionStatus.docs: Indicates whether Belvo's integration with the institution is currently active (`healthy`) or undergoing maintenance (`down`).

EnumInstitutionType.docs:
The type of institution. We return one of the following values:

  - `bank`
  - `fiscal`
  - `employment`

EnumInvestmentPortfolioInstrumentType.docs:
The instrument type. For more information about instruments, please see our [Investments DevPortal article](https://developers.belvo.com/docs/investments#instruments).

We return one of the following values:

  - `BOND`
  - `DEPOSIT`
  - `ETF`
  - `FUND`
  - `OTHER`
  - `PENSION`
  - `STOCK`

EnumInvestmentPortfolioType.docs:
The portfolio type.

We return one of the following values:

  - `FIXED_INCOME`
  - `OTHER`
  - `PENSION`
  - `VARIABLE_INCOME`

EnumInvoiceAllowedIncomeTypesRequest.docs:
The categories of the incomes you want to get information for. 
You can send through one or more of the following values:
  - `SALARY`
  - `GOVERNMENT`
  - `INTEREST`
  - `RENT`
  - `RETIREMENT`
  - `FREELANCE`
  - `ALTERNATIVE_INCOME`
  - `TRANSFER`
  - `DEPOSIT`
  - `UNKNOWN`

EnumInvoiceDianInvoiceType.docs:
The fiscal institution's classification of the invoice.

For Colombia's DIAN, we return one of the following values:

  - `Factura Electrnica de Venta`

EnumInvoiceDianPaymentMethod.docs:
The payment method used for this invoice, as defined by the legal entity of the country.

For DIAN Colombia, we return one of the following values:

  - `Contado`
  - `Crdito`
  - `null`

EnumInvoiceSatInvoiceType.docs:
The fiscal institution's classification of the invoice.

For Mexico's SAT, we return one of the following values:

  - `Egreso`
  - `Ingreso`
  - `Nmina`
  - `Pago`
  - `Traslado`

EnumInvoiceSatPaymentMethod.docs:
The payment method code used for this invoice, as defined by the legal entity of the country.

-  Mexico [SAT catalog reference article](https://developers.belvo.com/docs/sat-catalogs#payment-method). For Mexico, we return `PUE`, `PIP`, `PPD`, or `null`.

EnumInvoiceType.docs:
The direction of the invoice (from the perspective of the Link owner).
- `OUTFLOW` indicates a sent invoice. - `INFLOW` indicates a received invoice.

EnumLinkAccessModeRequest.docs:
The type of link to create.

- Use `single` to do ad hoc one-time POST requests for accounts, owners, and transactions.
- Use `recurrent` to have Belvo access information on a recurrent basis so you always have fresh account, owner, balance, and transaction data.

For more information, see our [Links](https://developers.belvo.com/docs/links-and-institutions#links) article.

EnumLinkAccessModeResponse.docs:
The link type.
For more information, see our [Links](https://developers.belvo.com/docs/links-and-institutions#links) article.
We return one of the following enum values:
  - `single`
  - `recurrent`
  - `null`

EnumLinkRefreshRate.docs:
The update refresh rate for the recurrent link. For more information, check out our [recurrent link documentation](https://developers.belvo.com/docs/links-and-institutions#recurrent-links) in our DevPortal.
We return one of the following enum values:
  - `6h`
  - `12h`
  - `24h`
  - `7d` (default)
  - `30d` (once a month)
  - `null` (for single links)

EnumLinkStatus.docs:
The current status of the link. For more information, see our [Link](https://developers.belvo.com/docs/links-and-institutions#links) article in the devportal.
We return one of the following values:
  - `valid`
  - `invalid`
  - `unconfirmed`
  - `token_required`

EnumLoanDataFeeType.docs:
The type of fee. We return one of the following values:

  - `OPERATION_FEE`
  - `INSURANCE_FEE`
  - `OTHERS`

EnumLoanDataInterestRateType.docs:
The period that the interest is applied to the loan. We return one of the following values:

  - `MONTHLY`
  - `YEARLY`

EnumPaymentIntentHolderTypePse.docs: Type of bank account holder. For PSE, this value must be `INDIVIDUAL`.

EnumPaymentIntentStatus.docs: The current status of the payment intent.

EnumPaymentLinkAllowedPaymentMethod.docs:
Selected payment method type.

  - For  Brazil's OFPI, the value must be `open_finance`.  
  - For  Colombia's PSE, the value must be `pse`.

EnumPaymentLinkProvider.docs:
The provider used for the payment link. 


- For  Brazil's OFPI, the value must be `belvo`.  
- For  Colombia's PSE, the value must be `payments_way`.

EnumPaymentLinksStatus.docs:
The current status of the payment link. Can be either:

  - `ACTIVE` meaning that the payment intent's status is either `REQUIRES_PAYMENT_METHOD`, `REQUIRES_ACTION`, or `PROCESSING`.
  - `INACTIVE` meaning that the payment intent's status is either `SUCCEEDED` or `FAILED`.

**Note:** You can retrieve the complete payment intent by using our [Get details of a payment link](https://developers.belvo.com/reference/detailcreatepaymentlink) request.

EnumPaymentTransactionType.docs:
The direction of the transaction.

  - `INFLOW` indicates money coming into the account.
  - `OUTFLOW` indicates money coming out of the account.

EnumPaymentsCountry.docs:
The customer's country of residence.


-  BRA ( Brazil)
-  COL ( Colombia)

EnumPaymentsCurrency.docs:
The currency of the amount paid.


  -  BRL (Brazilian Real)
  -  COP (Colombian Peso)

EnumReceivableTransactionFeeType.docs:
The type of fee applied to the transaction. We return one of the following values:

  - `TRANSACTION_FEE`

EnumReceivableTransactionStatus.docs:
The status of the transaction. Can be either:

  - `APPROVED`
  - `CANCELLED`
  - `REVERTED`
  - `UNCATEGORIZED`

EnumReceivableTransactionType.docs:
The type of transaction. For example, whether the transaction was a `VISA_DEBIT` or a `MASTERCARD_CREDIT`.

We return one of the following values:

  - `VISA_CREDIT`
  - `VISA_DEBIT`
  - `MASTERCARD_CREDIT`
  - `MASTERCARD_DEBIT`
  - `ELO_CREDIT`
  - `ELO_DEBIT`
  - `null`

EnumRecurringExpenseCategory.docs:
The transaction category for the recurring expense. For more information on the available categories, please see our [Transaction categorization documentation](https://developers.belvo.com/docs/banking#categorizing-transactions).

- `Online Platforms & Leisure` (Netflix, Spotify, Gym Memberships)
- `Bills & Utilities` (electricity, telephone, internet)
- `Credits & Loans` (credit card cash advances, student loan, watercraft lease)
- `Insurance` (home, car, and health & life insurance)
- `Transport & Travel` (Uber trip, airbnb, parking)
- `Taxes` (service fee, donation, court taxes)

EnumRecurringExpenseFrequency.docs:
The frequency at which this recurring expense occurs.


 **Note:** Belvo only identifies `MONTHLY` frequencies.

EnumRecurringExpensePaymentType.docs:
The type of recurring expense. We return one of the following values:

  - `SUBSCRIPTION`
  - `REGULAR`

EnumTaxComplianceStatusOutcome.docs: Indicates whether the taxpayer is complying to all their tax obligations (`POSITIVE`), if they are not (`NEGATIVE`), or have none to comply to (`NO_OBLIGATIONS`).

EnumTaxRetentionPaymentStatus.docs:
Indicates whether or not the tax has been paid or not. Can be either:
  - `PAID`
  - `PROVISIONED`

EnumTaxRetentionReceiverNationality.docs:
Whether the invoice receiver is a Mexican national or not. If the receiver is not considered a Mexican national, the retained taxes can be calculated differently. Possible values:
  - `NATIONAL`
  - `FOREIGN`

EnumTaxRetentionType.docs:
The type of tax retention in relation to the invoice (from the perspective of the Link owner).

- `OUTFLOW` relates to a tax retention for a sent invoice.
- `INFLOW` related to a tax retention for a received invoice.

EnumTransactionBillStatus.docs:
The status of the bill that the transaction appears on. Can be one of:

  - `PAID`: The bill has been paid in full.
  - `CLOSED`: The bill has been closed by the institution.
  - `OPEN`: The bill is currently open. (Note: This is the main bill that Belvo retrieves balance data from).
  - `FUTURE`: The bill is pending.
  - `null`: No bill status was identified.
  
 Note: Some banks consider CLOSED as PAID.

EnumTransactionCategory.docs:
The name of the category to which this transaction belongs.

> **Get transaction categorization**
With [Transaction categorization](https://developers.belvo.com/docs/banking#categorizing-transactions), we clean and categorize transactions for you, turning raw data into actionable insights. To enable this feature, just [reach out](https://belvo.com/contact/?utm_source=documentation) to us, and we'll get right to it.

We return one of the following enum values:

  - `Bills & Utilities`
  - `Credits & Loans`
  - `Deposits`
  - `Fees & Charges`
  - `Food & Groceries`
  - `Home & Life`

  - `Transport & Travel`
  - `Unknown`*
  - `Withdrawal & ATM`
  - `null`


  \* For clients not using our Transaction Categorization product, we return `null` instead.

EnumTransactionStatus.docs:
The status of the transaction. We return one of the following values:

  - `PENDING`
  - `PROCESSED`
  - `UNCATEGORIZED`
  - `null`

  > **Get transaction categorization**

EnumTransactionType.docs:
The direction of the transaction:
- `INFLOW` indicates money coming into the account.
- `OUTFLOW` indicates money going out of the account.
- `null` when no information was present regarding the direction of the transaction.

EquityStatementBusiness.docs: Object containing the general fiscal situation of the taxpayer.

accounts_documents_and_finance_leases_re.docs: Total of all payments the company expects to receive (for example, from partial invoices that have not been paid yet).

cash_and_cash_equivalents.docs: Total cash (or cash equivalents) that the business currently holds at the end of the fiscal year.

debts.docs: Total debts that the company currently has.

inventory.docs: Total financial value of the company's sellable inventory.

investments_and_derivative_financial_ins.docs: Total value of all investments, stocks, or similar, that the company has.

property_plant_and_equipment_investment_.docs: Total value of real estate, plant infrastructure, or equipment that has been purchased.

total_net_equity.docs: The total net equity of the company (`total_gross_equity` - `debts`).

EquityStatementIndividual.docs: Object containing the general fiscal situation of the taxpayer.

total_debts.docs: The total debts of the tax_payer

total_gross_equity.docs: The total gross equity of the tax payer.

total_net_equity.docs: The total net equity value of the taxpayer.

account_holder_id.docs: Your unique ID for the account holder, in UUID format.

account_id.docs: Your unique ID for the account where the transaction occurred.

currency.docs:
The three-letter currency code of the income. For example:

    BRL (Brazilian Real)
    COP (Colombian Peso)
    MXN (Mexican Peso)

institution.docs:
The institution where the account is registered.

**Note:** This is the name that you use in your system to identify the institution. For example BBVA Retail.

transaction_id.docs: Your unique ID for the income.

value_date.docs: The date when the income transaction occurred, in `YYYY-MM-DD` format.

GrossIncomeIndividual.docs: Object containing the declared gross income of the tax payer.

capital_income.docs: Income received from an investment (such as dividends or from renting a property).

fee_based_income.docs: Income received from emitted invoices (for example, income that independent contractors or freelancers receive).

non_labor_income.docs: Income that cannot be classified into the other three fields (such as income from cryptocurrencies or regular transfers from parents).

HolderBankAccountInformationPse.docs: Object with additional information about the individual that holds the bank account.

HolderBankAccountPse.docs: Details regarding the bank account holder.

INDIVIDUAL.docs: Details about the OFPI payment method.

created_at.docs: The ISO-8601 timestamp of when the data point was created in Belvo's database.

first_transaction_date.docs: The date when the first transaction occurred, in `YYYY-MM-DD` format.

id.docs: Belvo's unique identifier for the current income.

income_streams.docs: An array of enriched income stream objects.

last_transaction_date.docs: The date when when the last transaction occurred, in `YYYY-MM-DD` format.

link.docs: The `link.id` the account belongs to.

monthly_average.docs: Average amount of income received per month across all the accounts for the specific user.

monthly_average_high_confidence.docs: Average amount of income received per month for the specific user with `HIGH` confidence.

monthly_average_irregular.docs: Average amount of irregular income (with a frequency of `SINGLE` or `IRREGULAR`) received per month for the specific user.

monthly_average_low_confidence.docs: Average amount of income received per month for the specific user with `LOW` confidence.

monthly_average_medium_confidence.docs: Average amount of income received per month for the specific user with `MEDIUM` confidence.

monthly_average_regular.docs: Average amount of regular income (with a frequency of `MONTHLY`, `FORTNIGHTLY`, or `WEEKLY`) received per month for the specific user.

number_of_income_streams.docs: Number of total income streams analized.

total_high_confidence.docs: Total amount of income for the specific user with `HIGH` confidence.

total_income_amount.docs: Total amount of all income received for the specific user.

total_irregular_income_amount.docs: Total amount of irregular income (with a frequency of `SINGLE` or `IRREGULAR`) for the specific user.

total_low_confidence.docs: Total amount of income for the specific user with `LOW` confidence.

total_medium_confidence.docs: Total amount of income for the specific user with `MEDIUM` confidence.

total_regular_income_amount.docs: Total amount of regular income (with a frequency of `MONTHLY`, `FORTNIGHTLY`, `WEEKLY`) for the specific user.

IncomeStreamsBody.docs:
A list of income streams for the account.

For each income stream, we provide additional insights such as:
- Frequency, stability, and confidence level of the income transactions.
- Key metrics about the transaction amounts.
 If no income sources are found, we return an empty array.

account_id.docs: Unique ID for the bank account to be verified for income streams.

average_income_amount.docs: The average income transaction amount from the source.

currency.docs:
The three-letter currency code of the income. For example:

    BRL (Brazilian Real)
    COP (Colombian Peso)
    MXN (Mexican Peso)

full_periods.docs:
Number of period units (based on *rolling months*) with data to perform calculations.

**Note:** A *rolling month* is a period of 30 days. For example, 2023-01-15 to 2023-02-2023.

last_income_amount.docs: The amount of the most recent income received from the source.

last_income_date.docs: The date when the most recent income from the stream was received, in `YYYY-MM-DD` format.

lookback_periods.docs:
Number of period units (based on *rolling months*) used to generate insights and calculations.

**Note:** A *rolling month* is a period of 30 days. For example, 2023-01-15 to 2023-02-2023.

monthly_average.docs: The average amount of income received from the source over `lookback_periods`.

number_of_incomes.docs: Number of income transactions over the `lookback_periods`.

periods_with_income.docs:
Number of period units (based on *rolling months*) with at least one income available.

**Note:** A *rolling month* is a period of 30 days. For example, 2023-01-15 to 2023-02-2023.

regularity.docs:
The regularity of the income basde in its frequency, with a range from 0 to 1, where 1 represents perfect regularity.

**Note:** For transactions with `frequency`=`SINGLE`, this value returns `null`.

stability.docs:
The stability of the income based on its amount, with a range from 0 to 1, where 1 represents perfect stability.

**Note:** For transactions with `frequency`=`SINGLE`, this value returns `null`.

trend.docs:
The income trend during a period of time calculated between last income and first income received, where:
  - a negative float means that the income trend is decreasing during the time period.
  - a positive float means that the income trend is increasing during the time period.

**Note:** For transactions with `frequency`=`SINGLE`, this value returns `null`.

count.docs: The total number of results in your Belvo account.

next.docs:
The URL to next page of results. Each page consists of up to 100 items. If there are not enough results for an additional page, the value is `null`.

In our documentation example, we use `{endpoint}` as a placeholder value. In production, this value will be replaced by the actual endpoint you are currently using (for example, `accounts` or `owners`).

previous.docs: The URL to the previous page of results. If there is no previous page, the value is `null`.

country_codes.docs:
The country codes where the institution is available, for example:
-  BR (Brazil)
-  CO (Colombia)
-  MX (Mexico)

display_name.docs: The customer-facing name of the institution.

features.docs:
The features that the institution supports. If the institution has no special features, then Belvo returns an empty array.

Here is a list of the available features:
- `token_required` indicates that the institution may require a token during link creation or when making any other requests.

icon_logo.docs: The URL of the institution's icon logo.

id.docs: The ID of the institution as designated by Belvo.

logo.docs: The URL of the institution's logo.

name.docs:
The name of the institution, as designated by Belvo.
Please see our [Institutions](https://developers.belvo.com/docs/institution) DevPortal article for a detailed list of institution names.

primary_color.docs: The primary color on the institution's website.

resources.docs:
A list of Belvo resources that you can use with the institution. This list includes one or more of the following resources:

  - `ACCOUNTS`
  - `BALANCES`
  - `INCOMES`
  - `INVESTMENTS_PORTFOLIOS`

text_logo.docs: The URL of the institution's text logo.

name.docs:
The name of the institution, as designated by Belvo.
Please see our [Institutions](https://developers.belvo.com/docs/institution) DevPortal article for a detailed list of institution names.

InstitutionDownError.docs: This error occurs when the institution's website that you're trying to access is down due to maintenance or other issues, which means Belvo is unable to create new links or retrieve new data.

message.docs:
A short description of the error. 

For `institution_down` errors, the description is:
  
  - `The financial institution is down, try again later`.

request_id.docs: A 32-character unique ID of the request (matching a regex pattern of: `[a-f0-9]{32}`). Provide this ID when contacting the Belvo support team to accelerate investigations.

- Document

- Token

validation.docs: The type of input validation used for the field.

validation_message.docs: The message displayed when an invalid input is provided in the form field.

values.docs: Array of additional form field values.

InstitutionInactiveError.docs: This error occurs when we (Belvo) have deactivated the institution in our API.

A short description of the error. 

For `invalid_period` errors, the description is:

balance_net.docs:
The total current value of the entire portfolio and all its underlying instruments, as given by the institution.

 **Note:** In Brazil, this is usually calculated based on the net value (that is, not including tax).

balance_type.docs: Indicates whether this account is either an `ASSET` or a `LIABILITY`. You can consider the balance of an `ASSET` as being positive, while the balance of a `LIABILITY` as negative.

currency.docs:
The currency of the portfolio. For example:


-  BRL (Brazilian Real)
-  COP (Colombian Peso)
-  MXN (Mexican Peso)


Please note that other currencies other than in the list above may be returned.

receiver_tax_fraud_status.docs:
Indicates whether or not the receiver is on SAT's tax fraud list for having submitted incorrect data, having outstanding payments, or having conducted business that is in violation of the fiscal institution's regulations.

SAT updates the tax fraud list every three months.

For more information regarding the reason's a taxpayer can be put on the tax fraud list, please see [Article 69](http://omawww.sat.gob.mx/cifras_sat/Paginas/datos/vinculo.html?page=ListCompleta69.html) and [Article 69-B](http://omawww.sat.gob.mx/cifras_sat/Paginas/datos/vinculo.html?page=ListCompleta69B.html) of Mexico's Cdigo Fiscal de la Federacin.

Possible statuses are: - `INVESTIGATING`
The fiscal institution has identified irregularities and open an investigation regarding the taxpayer.
- `DISMISSED`
The fiscal institution has investigated the taxpayer and declared them innocent.
- `CONFIRMED`
The fiscal institution has confirmed that the taxpayer is guilty.
- `OVERTURNED`
The fiscal institution has reassessed a previously confirmed taxpayer and, based on new evidence, has taken the taxpayer off the tax fraud list.
- `NO_TAX_FRAUD_STATUS`
The receiver or sender is not found in the list (in other words, they are complying with the fiscal institution's regulations).

sender_tax_fraud_status.docs:
Indicates whether or not the sender is on SAT's tax fraud list for having submitted incorrect data, having outstanding payments, or having conducted business that is in violation of the fiscal institution's regulations.

SAT updates the tax fraud list every three months.

For more information regarding the reason's a taxpayer can be put on the tax fraud list, please see [Article 69](http://omawww.sat.gob.mx/cifras_sat/Paginas/datos/vinculo.html?page=ListCompleta69.html) and [Article 69-B](http://omawww.sat.gob.mx/cifras_sat/Paginas/datos/vinculo.html?page=ListCompleta69B.html) of Mexico's Cdigo Fiscal de la Federacin.

Possible statuses are: - `INVESTIGATING`
The fiscal institution has identified irregularities and open an investigation regarding the taxpayer.
- `DISMISSED`
The fiscal institution has investigated the taxpayer and declared them innocent.
- `CONFIRMED`
The fiscal institution has confirmed that the taxpayer is guilty.
- `OVERTURNED`
The fiscal institution has reassessed a previously confirmed taxpayer and, based on new evidence, has taken the taxpayer off the tax fraud list.
- `NO_TAX_FRAUD_STATUS`
The receiver or sender is not found in the list (in other words, they are complying with the fiscal institution's regulations).

LastErrorPaymentError.docs: Information about the error you ran into in the previous step of the payment intent, if applicable. This error can occur when something unexpected happened during the payment intent process.

error_message.docs: A short description of the error.

LastErrorSessionExpired.docs: Information about the error you ran into in the previous step of the payment intent, if applicable. This error occurs when you try to send a PATCH request after the session has already expired (the session expires after 10 minutes).

error_code.docs: A unique error code (`session_expired`) that allows you to classify and handle the error programmatically.

error_message.docs: A short description of the error.

LastErrorTwoFactor.docs: Information about the error you ran into in the previous step of the payment intent, if applicable. This error can occur when something unexpected happened in the `pse_display_token_required` next step.

external_id.docs: The `external_id` you provided as an additional identifier for the link. For more information, see our [Link creation article](https://developers.belvo.com/docs/link-creation-best-practices#adding-your-own-identifier).

id.docs: Belvo's unique ID for the current Link.

institution_user_id.docs: > Info: Only applicable for links created after 08-02-2022. A unique 44-character string that can be used to identify a user at a given institution. Check out our [Avoiding duplicated links](https://developers.belvo.com/docs/link-creation-best-practices#avoiding-duplicated-links) DevPortal article for more information and tips on how to use it.

last_accessed_at.docs: The ISO-8601 timestamp of Belvo's most recent successful access to the institution for the given link.

LoginError.docs:
This error can occur when:

  - the credentials that your user provides are incorrect or missing.
  - the MFA token your user provides is not supported by Belvo.
  - there is an issue with the institution that prevents logins.
  - the user's account is either locked or the user does not have permission to access their internet banking.

message.docs:
A short description of the error. 

For `login_error` errors, the description can be one of the following:

  - `Invalid credentials provided to login to the institution`
  - `A MFA token is required by the institution, but it's not supported yet by Belvo.`
  - `Impossible to login, something unexpected happened while logging into the institution. Try again later.`
  - `Login not attempted due to invalid credentials`
  - `Missing credentials to login to the institution`
  - `The user account access was forbidden by the institution`
  - `The user account is locked, user needs to contact the institution to unlock it`

request_id.docs: A 32-character unique ID of the request (matching a regex pattern of: `[a-f0-9]{32}`). Provide this ID when contacting the Belvo support team to accelerate investigations.

NetIncomeIndividual.docs: Object containing the declared net income of the tax payer. The values are calculated as the `gross_income` - `non_taxable_income`.

capital_income.docs: Income received from an investment (such as dividends or from renting a property).

fee_based_income.docs: Income received from emitted invoices (for example, income independent contractors or freelancers receive).

non_labor_income.docs: Income that cannot be classified into the other three fields (such as income from cryptocurrencies or regular transfers from parents).

ready_to_confirm.docs:
Boolean that indicates whether the payment intent is ready to be confirmed. This value will return: 

  - `false` when a customer wants to pay for the very first time. This is so because you still need to input information about your customer in the following steps to process a payment successfully. 
  - `true` when a customer wants to pay and this is not their first time. This is so because the payment intent has all the information needed about the customer to process a payment. 


**Note:** When the value is `true`, you'll need to confirm the payment intent. You can do this by making a PATCH request sending through the parameter `confirm: true`.

document_type.docs:
The type of document the owner provided to the institution to open the account. Common document types are:

 Brazil
- `CPF` (*Cadastro de Pessoas Fsicas*)
- `CNPJ`(*Cadastro Nacional de Pessoas Jurdicas*)

 Colombia
- `CC`(*Cdula de Ciudadana*)
- `NIT` (*Nmero de Identificacin Tributaria*)

 Mexico
- `CURP` (*Clave nica de Registro de Poblacin*)
- `NISS` (*Nmero de Seguridad Social*)

PatchBody.docs: A JSON object containing a session UUID and a MFA token

link.docs: The `link.id` you want to resume. Must be the same `link.id` as the one you receive in the 428 Token Required response that contains the `session` ID.

save_data.docs:
Indicates whether or not to persist the data in Belvo. By default, this is set to `true` and we return a 201 Created response.
When set to `false`, the data won't be persisted and we return a 200 OK response.

session.docs: The session you want to resume. You need to use the `session` value that is provided in the 428 Token Required response that you receive after you make your POST request.

token.docs: The MFA token generated by the institution and required to continue a session.

In our documentation example, we use `{endpoint}` as a placeholder value. In production, this value will be replaced by the actual endpoint you are currently using (for example, `accounts` or `owners`).

previous.docs: The URL to the previous page of results. If there is no previous page, the value is `null`.

RecevablesTransactionFees.docs: Details regarding the fees applied to the transaction.

RecurringExpenseSourceTransaction.docs: An array of minified transaction objects used to evaluate the recurring expense. If no transactions were found, we return an empty array.

description.docs: The description of the transaction provided by the institution. Usually, this is the text that the end user would see in the bank statement. The description can be an empty string.

value_date.docs: The date when the transaction occurred, in `YYYY-MM-DD` format.

RecurringExpenses.docs:
Recurring expense insights.


 If no recurring expense insights are found, we return an empty array.

average_transaction_amount.docs: The average transaction amount of the recurring expense.

days_since_last_transaction.docs:
Number of days since the last recurring expense occurred.

Based on the frequency, you can infer how many days until the next charge will occur.

id.docs: Belvo's unique identifier used to reference the current recurring expense.

median_transaction_amount.docs: The median transaction amount of the recurring expense.

name.docs: Monthly payment to John

transactions.docs: An array of minified transaction objects used to evaluate the recurring expense. If no transactions were found, we return an empty array.

count.docs: The total number of results in your Belvo account.

next.docs:
The URL to next page of results. Each page consists of up to 100 items. If there are not enough results for an additional page, the value is `null`.

In our documentation example, we use `{endpoint}` as a placeholder value. In production, this value will be replaced by the actual endpoint you are currently using (for example, `accounts` or `owners`).

previous.docs: The URL to the previous page of results. If there is no previous page, the value is `null`.

ReportingId.docs: Object containing information about where the tax payer reports their income.

reporting_type.docs: The type of reporting ID. For DIAN, this is the sectional address code (*Codigo Dirrecion Seccional*)

reporting_value.docs: The value of the reporting ID.

RequestTimeoutErrorBody.docs: Belvo has a limit regarding the time it takes to log in, retrieve account data, and log out. A timeout occurs when there is a very high amount of data and everything could not be obtained within the allotted time.

message.docs:
A short description of the error. 

For `request_timeout` errors, the description is:
  
  - `The request timed out, you can retry asking for less data by changing your query parameters`.

request_id.docs: A 32-character unique ID of the request (matching a regex pattern of: `[a-f0-9]{32}`). Provide this ID when contacting the Belvo support team to accelerate investigations.

RetentionBreakdown.docs: A breakdown of the retained taxes

base_amount.docs: The base amount that was used to calculate the tax retention.

tax_type.docs: Optional attribute to indicate the type of tax withheld for the period or year according to the [SAT catalog](https://developers.belvo.com/docs/sat-catalogs#retention-code).

accounts.docs: An array of Belvo-generated account numbers (UUIDs) that were used during the risk insights analysis. If no accounts were found, we return an empty array.

created_at.docs: The ISO-8601 timestamp of when the data point was last updated in Belvo's database.

id.docs: Belvo's unique ID for the risk insights request.

link.docs: The `link.id` the risk insights analysis belongs to.

RiskInsightsBalanceMetrics.docs: Balance metrics calculated based on the user's balances from checking and savings accounts.

balance_threshold_x.docs: The threshold used to compute `days_balance_below_x_period`. Please note, this is value is country specific (both in terms of the amount and the currency).

closing_balance.docs: The balance of all the accounts at the `collected_at` time.

days_balance_below_0_1m.docs: The number of days that the total balance of the account is less than or equal to 0 in the last month.

days_balance_below_0_1w.docs: The number of days that the total balance of the account is less than or equal to 0 in the last week.

days_balance_below_0_3m.docs: The number of days that the total balance of the account is less than or equal to 0 in the last three months.

days_balance_below_x_1m.docs: The number of days that the total balance of the account is less than or equal to the amount specified in `balance_threshold_x` in the last month.

days_balance_below_x_1w.docs: The number of days that the total balance of the account is less than or equal to the amount specified in `balance_threshold_x` in the last week.

days_balance_below_x_3m.docs: The number of days that the total balance of the account is less than or equal to the amount specified in `balance_threshold_x` in the last three months.

max_balance_1m.docs: The maximum balance in the period (one month).

max_balance_1w.docs: The maximum balance in the period (one week).

max_balance_3m.docs: The maximum balance in the period (three months).

min_balance_1m.docs: The minimum balance in the period (one month).

min_balance_1w.docs: The minimum balance in the period (one week).

min_balance_3m.docs: The minimum balance in the period (three months).

RiskInsightsCashflowMetrics.docs:
Aggregated metrics calculated based on the user's transactions from checking, savings, credit, and loan accounts.

However, internal transfers (transfers between accounts belonging to the same link) are not used in the calculation.

positive_to_negative_ratio_1m.docs:
The ratio between sum_positive / sum_negative  in the last month (counted from the time of the request).

If the ratio is greater than `1`, it means that the user has more income than outgoing, indicating that they spend less than they earn.

positive_to_negative_ratio_1w.docs:
The ratio between sum_positive / sum_negative  in the last week (counted from the time of the request).

If the ratio is greater than `1`, it means that the user has more income than outgoing, indicating that they spend less than they earn.

**Note**: In the case that there have been no outgoing transactions, the value will be `null`.

positive_to_negative_ratio_3m.docs:
The ratio between sum_positive / sum_negative  in the last three months (counted from the time of the request).

If the ratio is greater than `1`, it means that the user has more income than outgoing, indicating that they spend less than they earn.

sum_negative_1m.docs: Sum total of all transactions leading to a negative cashflow in the last month (counted from the time of the request).

sum_negative_1w.docs: Sum total of all transactions leading to a negative cashflow in the last week (counted from the time of the request).

sum_negative_3m.docs: Sum total of all transactions leading to a negative cashflow in the last three months (counted from the time of the request).

sum_positive_1m.docs: Sum total of all transactions leading to a positive cashflow in the last month (counted from the time of the request).

sum_positive_1w.docs: Sum total of all transactions leading to a positive cashflow in the last week (counted from the time of the request).

sum_positive_3m.docs: Sum total of all transactions leading to a positive cashflow in the last three months (counted from the time of the request).

RiskInsightsCreditCardMetrics.docs: Aggregated metrics calculated based on the link's credit card accounts.

num_accounts.docs: Number of credit cards accounts associated to the link.

sum_credit_limit.docs: Sum total of all credit cards' limits.

sum_credit_used.docs: Sum total of all credit used.

RiskInsightsLoansMetrics.docs: Aggregated metrics calculated based on the user's loan accounts.

num_accounts.docs: Number of loan accounts associated with the link.

sum_loans_monthly_payment.docs: Sum total of the monthly payments for all the link's loan accounts.

sum_loans_outstanding_principal.docs: Sum total of the outstanding principal for all the link's loan accounts.

sum_loans_principal.docs: Sum total of the principal for all of the link's loan accounts.

count.docs: The total number of results in your Belvo account.

RiskInsightsTransactionMetrics.docs: Aggregated metrics calculated band on the user's transactions from checking, savings, credit card, and loan accounts.

max_incoming_amount_1m.docs: The highest value inflow transaction in the last month.

max_incoming_amount_1w.docs: The highest value inflow transaction in the last week.

max_incoming_amount_3m.docs: The highest value inflow transaction in the last three months.

max_outgoing_amount_1m.docs: The highest value outflow transaction in the last month.

max_outgoing_amount_1w.docs: The highest value outflow transaction in the last week.

max_outgoing_amount_3m.docs: The highest value outflow transaction in the last three months.

mean_incoming_amount_1m.docs: The mean incoming value of all transactions in the last month.

mean_incoming_amount_1w.docs: The mean incoming value of all transactions in the last week.

mean_incoming_amount_3m.docs: The mean incoming value of all transactions in the last three months.

mean_outgoing_amount_1m.docs: The mean outgoing value of all transaction in the last month.

mean_outgoing_amount_1w.docs: The mean outgoing value of all transaction in the last week.

mean_outgoing_amount_3m.docs: The mean outgoing value of all transaction in the last three months.

num_incoming_transactions_1m.docs:
The total number of inflow transactions for the last month.

 **Note**: If there are no transactions between the request date and the last seven or thirty days, the value is `0`.

If the account has not been open long enough to have the transaction data for a given period, we return `null`. For example, if the account has only been open for five days, we return values for `_1w` and `_1m`, however, the value for `_3m` will be `null`.

num_incoming_transactions_1w.docs:
The total number of inflow transactions for the last week.

 **Note**: If there are no transactions between the request date and the last seven or thirty days, the value is `0`.

If the account has not been open long enough to have the transaction data for a given period, we return `null`. For example, if the account has only been open for five days, we return values for `_1w` and `_1m`, however, the value for `_3m` will be `null`.

num_incoming_transactions_3m.docs:
The total number of inflow transactions for the last three months.

 **Note**: If there are no transactions between the request date and the last seven or thirty days, the value is `0`.

If the account has not been open long enough to have the transaction data for a given period, we return `null`. For example, if the account has only been open for five days, we return values for `_1w` and `_1m`, however, the value for `_3m` will be `null`.

num_outgoing_transactions_1m.docs:
To total number of outflow transactions in the last month.

 **Note**: If there are no transactions between the request date and the last seven or thirty days, the value is `0`.

If the account has not been open long enough to have the transaction data for a given period, we return `null`. For example, if the account has only been open for five days, we return values for `_1w` and `_1m`, however, the value for `_3m` will be `null`.

num_outgoing_transactions_1w.docs:
To total number of outflow transactions in the last week.

 **Note**: If there are no transactions between the request date and the last seven or thirty days, the value is `0`.

If the account has not been open long enough to have the transaction data for a given period, we return `null`. For example, if the account has only been open for five days, we return values for `_1w` and `_1m`, however, the value for `_3m` will be `null`.

num_outgoing_transactions_3m.docs:
To total number of outflow transactions in the last three months.

 **Note**: If there are no transactions between the request date and the last seven or thirty days, the value is `0`.

If the account has not been open long enough to have the transaction data for a given period, we return `null`. For example, if the account has only been open for five days, we return values for `_1w` and `_1m`, however, the value for `_3m` will be `null`.

num_transactions_1m.docs: The total number of transactions analyzed to determine the risk insights for the last month (incoming and outgoing).

num_transactions_1w.docs: The total number of transactions analyzed to determine the risk insights for the last week (incoming and outgoing).

num_transactions_3m.docs: The total number of transactions analyzed to determine the risk insights for the last three months (incoming and outgoing).

sum_incoming_amount_1m.docs: The total sum of all inflow transactions for the last month.

sum_incoming_amount_1w.docs: The total sum of all inflow transactions for the last week.

sum_incoming_amount_3m.docs: The total sum of all inflow transactions for the last three months.

sum_outgoing_amount_1m.docs: The total sum of all outflow transactions for the last month.

sum_outgoing_amount_1w.docs: The total sum of all outflow transactions for the last week.

sum_outgoing_amount_3m.docs: The total sum of all outflow transactions for the last three months.

SessionExpiredError.docs: This error occurs when you try to resume a request session that has already expired. This is usually because the user took too long to provide their authentication token.

message.docs:
A short description of the error. 

For `session_expired` errors, the description is:
  
  - `The session you are trying to resume has expired, please start again from register/retrieve endpoint`.

request_id.docs: A 32-character unique ID of the request (matching a regex pattern of: `[a-f0-9]{32}`). Provide this ID when contacting the Belvo support team to accelerate investigations.

link.docs: The `link.id` that you want to get information for.

save_data.docs:
Indicates whether or not to persist the data in Belvo. By default, this is set to `true` and we return a 201 Created response.
When set to `false`, the data won't be persisted and we return a 200 OK response.

token.docs: The OTP token generated by the bank.

TaxAssessmentBusiness.docs: Object containing the calculated tax assessment of the tax payer. This includes the total taxable income, the income tax applied, and taxes already withheld.

fortuitous_profit_tax.docs: The tax applied on your unexpected income (such as lottery wins or house sales).

net_income_tax.docs: After additional deductions that you can apply, this will be the net income tax. If no further deduction are identified, this value will be the same as `total_tax_on_taxable_net_income`.

net_income_taxable.docs: The net income on which tax can be applied.

total_balance_in_favor.docs: How much the tax payer is expected to receive.

total_balance_payable.docs: How much the tax payer is required to pay.

total_payment.docs: The total the tax payer is required to pay, taking into account deductions and fiscal credits.

total_tax_due.docs: After further deductions, this is the final calculated tax that the taxpayer is required to pay.

total_tax_on_taxable_net_income.docs: The calculated total tax that can be applied on the tax payer's taxable income (total income - exemptions - deductions).

total_withholdings_for_the_taxable_year_.docs: How much the tax payer has already paid througout the fiscal year.

TaxAssessmentIndividual.docs: Object containing the calculated tax assessment of the tax payer. This includes the total taxable income, the income tax applied, and taxes already withheld.

balance_payable.docs: How much the tax payer is required to pay.

balance_refundable.docs: How much the tax payer is expected to receive. For DIAN, this will count as credit for the next fiscal year (see `previous_year_balance`).

fortuitous_profit_tax.docs: The tax applied on your unexpected income (such as lottery wins or house sales).

net_income_tax.docs: After additional deductions that you can apply, this will be the net income tax. If not further deduction are identified, this value will be the same as `total_tax_on_taxable_net_income`.

total_payment.docs: The total the tax payer is required to pay, taking into account deductions and fiscal credits.

total_tax_due.docs: After further deductions, this is the final calculated tax that the taxpayer is required to pay.

total_tax_on_taxable_net_income.docs: The calculated total tax that can be applied on the tax payer's taxable income (total income - exemptions - deductions).

total_withheld_tax.docs: The total tax already withheld in the current fiscal year.

The starting date you want to get tax returns for, in `YYYY-MM-DD` format.

 The value of `date_from` cannot be greater than `date_to`.

date_to.docs:
The date you want to stop getting tax returns for, in `YYYY-MM-DD` format.

 The value of `date_to` cannot be greater than today's date (in other words, no future dates).

In our documentation example, we use `{endpoint}` as a placeholder value. In production, this value will be replaced by the actual endpoint you are currently using (for example, `accounts` or `owners`).

previous.docs: The URL to the previous page of results. If there is no previous page, the value is `null`.

results.docs: Array of Personal Tax Return objects.

TaxReturnsYearlyRequest.docs: Request body for yearly tax returns

attach_pdf.docs: When this is set to `true`, you will receive the PDF as a binary string in the response.

link.docs: The fiscal `link.id` you want specific tax return information for.

save_data.docs:
Indicates whether or not to persist the data in Belvo. By default, this is set to `true` and we return a 201 Created response.
When set to `false`, the data won't be persisted and we return a 200 OK response.

type.docs:
The type of tax return to return. For yearly tax returns this must be set to `yearly`.

By default, Belvo returns the yearly (annual) tax returns.

year_from.docs: The starting year you want to get tax returns for, in `YYYY` format.

year_to.docs: The year you want to stop getting tax returns for, in `YYYY` format.

street_one.docs: **Note**: This field is not applicable for DIAN Colombia and will return `null`.

street_two.docs: **Note**: This field is not applicable for DIAN Colombia and will return `null`.

street_one.docs: The first street that `street` is located between.

street_two.docs: The second street that `street` is located between.

between_street.docs: **Note**: This field is not applicable for DIAN Colombia and will return `null`.

locality.docs: **Note**: This field is not applicable for DIAN Colombia and will return `null`.

state.docs: The state that the address is in.

suburb.docs: **Note**: This field is not applicable for DIAN Colombia and will return `null`.

between_street.docs: Additional information about where the `street` is located.

state.docs: The state that the address is in.

suburb.docs: The suburb of the tax payer.

collected_at.docs: The ISO-8601 timestamp when the data point was collected.

created_at.docs: The ISO-8601 timestamp of when the data point was last updated in Belvo's database.

digital_stamp.docs: The validation certificate of the document.

digital_stamp_chain.docs: **Note**: This field is not applicable for DIAN Colombia and will return `null`.

economic_activity.docs: A list of economic activity objects.

id.docs: Unique identifier created by Belvo used to reference the current Tax Status.

id_cif.docs: The taxpayer's *Cdula de ciudadana* (CC) ID. Only applicable for individuals.

link.docs: The `link.id` that the tax status is associated with.

obligations.docs:
Details regarding a business's obligations.

 For non-business accounts, this field will return empty.

official_name.docs:
The name of the business.

Note: For individuals in Colombia, this field will return `null`.

pdf.docs: Tax status PDF as a binary string.

place_and_date_of_issuance.docs: The date when the tax status was issued. For example, `2020-08-05/18:55:16`.

economic_activity.docs:
The economic activity code, according to the fiscal institution.

For detailed information regarding DIAN's economic activities, please see their [official PDF](https://www.dian.gov.co/impuestos/factura-electronica/Documents/Anexo_tecnico_factura_electronica_vr_1_7_2020.pdf).

end_date.docs: **Note**: This field is not applicable for DIAN Colombia and will return `null`.

initial_date.docs: The start date of the economic activity.

order.docs: The order of the economic activity.

percentage.docs: **Note**: This field is not applicable for DIAN Colombia and will return `null`.

economic_activity.docs: The description of the economic activity.

end_date.docs: The end date of the economic activity.

initial_date.docs: The start date of the economic activity.

order.docs: The order of the economic activity.

percentage.docs: The percentage of the economic activity.

TaxStatusObligationsDian.docs:
Details regarding a business's obligations.

 For non-business accounts, this field will return empty.

end_date.docs: **Note**: This field is not applicable for DIAN Colombia and will return `null`.

expiration.docs: **Note**: This field is not applicable for DIAN Colombia and will return `null`.

initial_date.docs: **Note**: This field is not applicable for DIAN Colombia and will return `null`.

obligation.docs: **Note**: This field is not applicable for DIAN Colombia and will return `null`.

Details regarding a business's obligations.

 For non-business accounts, this field will return empty.

expiration.docs: The deadline to fulfill the obligation, as imposed by the tax authority.

count.docs: The total number of results in your Belvo account.

next.docs:
The URL to next page of results. Each page consists of up to 100 items. If there are not enough results for an additional page, the value is `null`.

In our documentation example, we use `{endpoint}` as a placeholder value. In production, this value will be replaced by the actual endpoint you are currently using (for example, `accounts` or `owners`).

previous.docs: The URL to the previous page of results. If there is no previous page, the value is `null`.

end_date.docs: **Note**: This field is not applicable for DIAN Colombia and will return `null`.

initial_date.docs: **Note**: This field is not applicable for DIAN Colombia and will return `null`.

end_date.docs: The end date of the regimen.

initial_date.docs: The start date of the regimen.

digital_stamp.docs: The validation certificate of the document.

digital_stamp_chain.docs: A data chain containing the basic structure of a fiscal digital check. For Mexico, this is the *Comprobante Fiscal Digital por Internet* (CFDI).

economic_activity.docs: A list of economic activity objects.

id_cif.docs: The taxpayer's *Cdula de Identificacin Fiscal* (CIF) ID.

Details regarding a business's obligations.

The name of the business designated for consumers and the general public.

email.docs: Contact email address for the tax payer.

first_last_name.docs: The tax payers's first last name.

The name of the business designated for consumers and the general public.

**Note**: Only applicable for businesses.

curp.docs: The tax payers's *Clave nica de Registro de Poblacin* (CURP) number.

email.docs: Contact email address for the tax payer.

first_last_name.docs: The tax payers's first last name.

last_status_change_date.docs: Date when `status_padron` was most recently updated.

name.docs: The tax payers's first name.

phone.docs: Contact phone number for the tax payer.

rfc.docs: The tax payers's identification number (For Mexico, this is the RFC).

second_last_name.docs: The tax payers's second last name.

social_name.docs:
The unique and exclusive name within the national territory that companies receive for legal or administrative purposes.
**Note**: Only applicable for businesses.

start_operations_date.docs: Date when the tax payer commenced taxable commercial activities.

status_padron.docs: Status of the taxpayer in the Federal Register of Taxpayers (RFC). Can be `ACTIVO` or `INACTIVO`.

link.docs: Unique identifier created by Belvo, used to reference the current Link.

message.docs:
A short description of the error. 

For `token_required` errors, the description is:
  
  - `A MFA token is required by the institution to login`.

request_id.docs: A 32-character unique ID of the request (matching a regex pattern of: `[a-f0-9]{32}`). Provide this ID when contacting the Belvo support team to accelerate investigations.

session.docs: A 32-character unique ID of the login session (matching a regex pattern of: `[a-f0-9]{32}`).

TokenRequiredResponseTokenGenerationData.docs: Details on how to generate the token.

expects_user_input.docs:
Indicates whether the user needs to provide input in order to complete the authentication.
When set to `false`, your user may need to:
- confirm the login on another device - scan a QR code
You will still need to make a PATCH call to complete the request.

type.docs: Type of the data to generate the token (QR code, numeric challenge).

value.docs: Value to use to generate the token.

TooManySessionsError.docs:
This error occurs when:

  - a user is attempting to log in to their institution via Belvo while also already being logged in to their institution on a web browser or mobile app.
  - you make a request for information while Belvo is scraping data from the institution for that user.

message.docs:
A short description of the error. 

For `too_many_sessions` errors, the description is:
  
  - `Impossible to login, a session is already opened with the institution for these credentials`.

request_id.docs: A 32-character unique ID of the request (matching a regex pattern of: `[a-f0-9]{32}`). Provide this ID when contacting the Belvo support team to accelerate investigations.

accounting_date.docs: The ISO timestamp when the transaction was processed and accounted for by the institution.

amount.docs:
The transaction amount.
 The amount displayed is always positive as we indicate the direction of the transaction in the `type` parameter.

balance.docs: The balance at the end of the transaction.

collected_at.docs: The ISO-8601 timestamp when the data point was collected.

created_at.docs: The ISO-8601 timestamp of when the data point was last updated in Belvo's database.

currency.docs: The three-letter currency code (ISO-4217).

description.docs: The description of transaction provided by the institution. Usually this is the text that the end user sees in the online platform.

id.docs: Belvo's unique ID for the transaction.

internal_identification.docs: The institution's internal identification for the transaction.

observations.docs: Additional observations provided by the institution on the transaction.

reference.docs: The reference number of the transaction, provided by the bank.

value_date.docs: The date when the transaction occurred, in `YYYY-MM-DD` format.

TransactionBankAccountBodyPse.docs: Information about the payer's bank account. Belvo returns the bank account ID when the account is already saved in the Belvo database.

bank_account.docs: Belvo's unique identifier for the payers bank account.

TransactionBankAccountOfpi.docs: Object containing the payer's bank account information. For OFPI, this field will return an empty object.

TransactionBankAccountPse.docs: Object containing the payer's bank account information.

TransactionCreditCardData.docs: Additional data provided by the institution for credit card transactions.

bill_amount.docs: The aggregate bill amount, as of `collected_at`.

bill_name.docs:
The title of the monthly credit card bill the transaction belongs to. The format of the returned value is institution specific, however, some common examples are:

- diciembre-2021
- dec-2021
- dec-21

collected_at.docs: The ISO-8601 timestamp when the data point was collected.

previous_bill_total.docs: The total amount of the previous month's bill, if available.

TransactionMerchantData.docs:
Additional data regarding the merchant involved in the transaction.
We only return merchant information for new transactions made from *checking* or *credit card* accounts.
> **Get merchant information**
 We retrieve the merchant information for a transaction as part of our [Transaction categorization](https://developers.belvo.com/docs/banking#categorizing-transactions) product, turning raw data into actionable insights. To enable this product, just [reach out](https://belvo.com/contact/?utm_source=documentation) to us, and we'll get right to it.

logo.docs: The URL to the merchant's logo.

website.docs: The URL to the merchant's website.

count.docs: The total number of results in your Belvo account.

next.docs:
The URL to next page of results. Each page consists of up to 100 items. If there are not enough results for an additional page, the value is `null`.

In our documentation example, we use `{endpoint}` as a placeholder value. In production, this value will be replaced by the actual endpoint you are currently using (for example, `accounts` or `owners`).

previous.docs: The URL to the previous page of results. If there is no previous page, the value is `null`.

account.docs: If provided, we return transactions only from this account.

date_from.docs:
The date from which you want to start getting transactions for, in `YYYY-MM-DD` format.

 The value of `date_from` cannot be greater than `date_to`.

date_to.docs:
The date you want to stop getting transactions for, in `YYYY-MM-DD` format.

 The value of `date_to` cannot be greater than today's date (in other words, no future dates).

link.docs: The `link.id` that you want to get information for.

save_data.docs:
Indicates whether or not to persist the data in Belvo. By default, this is set to `true` and we return a 201 Created response.
When set to `false`, the data won't be persisted and we return a 200 OK response.

token.docs: The OTP token generated by the bank.

UnauthorizedErrorBody.docs: This error occurs when you try to make an API call using incorrect Belvo API credentials (either your secret key or secret password, or both, are incorrect).

message.docs:
A short description of the error. 

For `authentication_failed` errors, the description is:

  - `Invalid Secret Keys`.

request_id.docs: A 32-character unique ID of the request (matching a regex pattern of: `[a-f0-9]{32}`). Provide this ID when contacting the Belvo support team to accelerate investigations.

UnconfirmedLinkError.docs:
This error occurs when you try to access a link that was paused previously (and as such is not active now).
A Link's status is set to `unconfirmed_link` when your user has not completed the Link creation process successfully (for example, they might not provide a valid MFA token).

message.docs:
A short description of the error. 

For `unconfirmed_link` errors, the description is:
  
  - `The link creation has not been completed yet`.

request_id.docs: A 32-character unique ID of the request (matching a regex pattern of: `[a-f0-9]{32}`). Provide this ID when contacting the Belvo support team to accelerate investigations.

UnexpectedError.docs: This error occurs when we (Belvo) have encountered an internal system error (sorry about that) or due to an unsupported response from the institution.

message.docs:
A short description of the error. 

For `unexpected_error` errors, the description is:
  
  - `Belvo is unable to process the request due to an internal system issue or to an unsupported response from an institution`.

request_id.docs: A 32-character unique ID of the request (matching a regex pattern of: `[a-f0-9]{32}`). Provide this ID when contacting the Belvo support team to accelerate investigations.

UnsupportedOperationError.docs: This error occurs when you try to access some data operation that Belvo does not support for an institution. For example, trying to access the Balances resource for fiscal institutions.

message.docs:
A short description of the error. 

For `unsupported_operation` errors, the description is:
  
  - `The resource you are trying to access is not supported by this institution`.

request_id.docs: A 32-character unique ID of the request (matching a regex pattern of: `[a-f0-9]{32}`). Provide this ID when contacting the Belvo support team to accelerate investigations.

ValidationError.docs: This error occurs when you try to resume a request session that has already expired. This is usually because the user took too long to provide their authentication token.

field.docs: Name of the field where the error was encountered.

message.docs:
A short description of the error. 

For `session_expired` errors, the description can be (among others):
  
  - `This field is required.`
  - `Object with name=narnia does not exist.`
  - `This field may not be null.`
  - `This field may not be blank.`

request_id.docs: A 32-character unique ID of the request (matching a regex pattern of: `[a-f0-9]{32}`). Provide this ID when contacting the Belvo support team to accelerate investigations.

__package__.yml.rawContents:
The ratio between sum_positive / sum_negative  in the last week (counted from the time of the request).

\_If the ratio is greater than `1`, it means that the user has more income than outgoing, indicating that they spend less than they earn.

**Note**: In the case that there have been no outgoing transactions, the value will be `null`.

The ratio between sum_positive / sum_negative  in the last month (counted from the time of the request).

\_If the ratio is greater than `1`, it means that the user has more income than outgoing, indicating that they spend less than they earn.

The ratio between sum_positive / sum_negative  in the last three months (counted from the time of the request).

\_If the ratio is greater than `1`, it means that the user has more income than outgoing, indicating that they spend less than they earn.

DestroyAccount.docs: Delete a specific account and all associated transactions, as well as owners, from your Belvo account.

code-samples.code:
curl -X DELETE \
  https://sandbox.belvo.com/api/accounts/{id}/ \
  -H 'Host: sandbox.belvo.com' \
  -u [Secret Key ID]:[Secret Key PASSWORD]

# check our Ruby gem on github
# https://github.com/belvo-finance/belvo-ruby
require 'belvo'

sandbox = Belvo::Client.new(
  'Secret Key ID',
  'Secret Key PASSWORD',
  'sandbox'
)

sandbox.accounts.delete id: 'account-id'
code-samples.name: Belvo Ruby SDK
Belvo Node SDK

id.docs: The `account.id` you want to delete

DetailAccount.docs:
Get the details of a specific account.

  >  Scheduled field deprecation
  >
  > Please note that we will soon be deprecating the following fields in our `loan_data` object:
  > - `cutting_date`
  > - `cutting_day`
  > - `credit_limit`: replaced by the `principal` field.
  > - `interest_rate`: replaced by the `interest_rates` object.
  > - `last_payment_date`
  > - `last_period_balance`: replaced by the `outstanding_balance ` field.
  > - `limit_day`
  > - `limit_date`: replaced by the `payment_day ` field.
  > - `no_interest_payment`
  > - `payment_due_day`

id.docs: The `account.id` you want to get detailed information about.

fields.docs: Return only the specified fields in the response. For more information, see our [Filtering responses](https://developers.belvo.com/docs/searching-and-filtering) DevPortal article.

omit.docs: Omit certain fields from being returned in the response. For more information, see our [Filtering responses](https://developers.belvo.com/docs/searching-and-filtering) DevPortal article.

ListAccounts.docs: Get a paginated list of all existing accounts in your Belvo account. By default, we return up to 100 results per page.

code-samples.code:
curl https://sandbox.belvo.com/api/accounts/ \
  -u [Secret Key ID]:[Secret Key PASSWORD]

# check our Ruby gem on github
# https://github.com/belvo-finance/belvo-ruby
require 'belvo'

sandbox = Belvo::Client.new(
  'Secret Key ID',
  'Secret Key PASSWORD',
  'sandbox'
)

sandbox.accounts.list
code-samples.name: Belvo Ruby SDK
Belvo Node SDK

balance__available.docs: Return accounts that have a `balance.available` matching exactly this value.

balance__available__gt.docs: Return accounts that have a `balance.available` greater than this value.

balance__available__gte.docs: Return accounts that have a `balance.available` greater than or equal to this value.

balance__available__lt.docs: Return accounts that have a `balance.available` less than this value.

balance__available__lte.docs: Return accounts that have a `balance.available` less than or equal to this value.

balance__available__range.docs: Return accounts that have a `balance.available` within a range of two values.

balance__current.docs: Return accounts that have a `balance.current` matching exactly this value.

balance__current__gt.docs: Return accounts that have a `balance.current` greater than this value.

balance__current__gte.docs: Return accounts that have a `balance.available` greater than or equal to this value.

balance__current__lt.docs: Return accounts that have a `balance.current` less than this value.

balance__current__lte.docs: Return accounts that have a `balance.available` less than or equal to this value.

balance__current__range.docs: Return accounts that have a `balance.available` within a range of two values.

category.docs: Return accounts only for the given category (for example, `CHECKING_ACCOUNT` and `SAVINGS_ACCOUNT`).

category__in.docs: Return accounts only for the given categories (for example, `CHECKING_ACCOUNT` and `SAVINGS_ACCOUNT`).

created_at__gt.docs: Return accounts that were last updated in Belvo's database after this date (`YYYY-MM-DD` or full `ISO-8601` timestamp).

created_at__gte.docs: Return accounts that were last updated in Belvo's database after or on this date (`YYYY-MM-DD` or full `ISO-8601` timestamp).

created_at__lt.docs: Return accounts that were last updated in Belvo's database before this date (`YYYY-MM-DD` or full `ISO-8601` timestamp).

created_at__lte.docs: Return accounts that were last updated in Belvo's database before or on this date (`YYYY-MM-DD` or full `ISO-8601` timestamp).

created_at__range.docs: Return accounts that were last updated in Belvo's database between two dates (`YYYY-MM-DD` or full `ISO-8601` timestamp).

currency.docs: Return accounts that hold finances in only this three-letter currency code.

currency__in.docs: Return accounts that hold finances in one of these three-letter currency codes.

fields.docs: Return only the specified fields in the response. For more information, see our [Filtering responses](https://developers.belvo.com/docs/searching-and-filtering) DevPortal article.

id.docs: Return information only for this `account.id`.

institution.docs: Return accounts only for this institution (use the Belvo-designated name, such as `erebor_mx_retail`).

institution__in.docs: Return accounts only for these institutions (use the Belvo-designated names, such as `erebor_mx_retail` and `gringotts_mx_retail`).

link.docs:
The `link.id` you want to filter by.

 We highly recommend adding the `link.id` filter in order to improve your performance.

name.docs: Return accounts with exactly this internal (specified by the institution) name.

name__icontains.docs: Return accounts partially matching this internal (specified by the institution) name.

number.docs: Return information only for this account number (as specified by the institution).

number__in.docs: Return information for these account numbers (as specified by the institution).

omit.docs: Omit certain fields from being returned in the response. For more information, see our [Filtering responses](https://developers.belvo.com/docs/searching-and-filtering) DevPortal article.

page.docs: A page number within the paginated result set.

page_size.docs:
Indicates how many results to return per page. By default we return 100 results per page. 

 The minimum number of results returned per page is 1 and the maximum is 1000. If you enter a value greater than 1000, our API will default to the maximum value (1000).

public_identification_name.docs: Return information only for this type of account ID. For example, CLABE accounts.

public_identification_value.docs: Return information only for this account ID. For example, the account number for a CLABE account.

type.docs: Return information only for accounts matching this account type, as designated by the institution.

PatchAccounts.docs:
Used to resume an Account retrieve session that was paused because an MFA token was required by the institution.

  > - `cutting_date`
  > - `cutting_day`
  > - `credit_limit`: replaced by the `principal` field.
  > - `interest_rate`: replaced by the `interest_rates` object.

  > - `limit_day`
  > - `limit_date`: replaced by the `payment_day ` field.
  > - `no_interest_payment`
  > - `payment_due_day`
